algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) to traverse levels and calculate sums.
problem_summary_simple: Find the tree level with the smallest sum of node values.
problem_summary_technical: Uses BFS to iterate through tree levels, calculating sum per level and tracking minimum sum with its corresponding level.
key_insights: BFS is ideal for level-order traversal and processing nodes level by level.
A tuple (sum, level) is used to easily find the minimum sum and its associated level, prioritizing lower levels in case of ties.
The queue stores nodes for the current level, and a new queue is built for the next level.
